Get the chunk IDs and files names

Source: R/get_chunk_ids.r
get_chunk_ids.Rd

Get the chunk IDs and files names

get_chunk_ids(df, ..., full.names = FALSE, strip_extension = TRUE)

Arguments

df

a disk.frame

...

passed to list.files

full.names

If TRUE returns the full path to the file, Defaults to FALSE

strip_extension

If TRUE then the file extension in the chunk_id is removed. Defaults to TRUE

Examples

cars.df = as.disk.frame(cars)

# return the integer-string chunk IDs
get_chunk_ids(cars.df)
#> 1.fst 2.fst 3.fst 4.fst 5.fst 6.fst 
#>   "1"   "2"   "3"   "4"   "5"   "6" 

# return the file name chunk IDs
get_chunk_ids(cars.df, full.names = TRUE)
#> [1] "C:\\Users\\RTX2080\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\Rtmp2LOQEk\\file361c69ed481d.df/1.fst"
#> [2] "C:\\Users\\RTX2080\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\Rtmp2LOQEk\\file361c69ed481d.df/2.fst"
#> [3] "C:\\Users\\RTX2080\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\Rtmp2LOQEk\\file361c69ed481d.df/3.fst"
#> [4] "C:\\Users\\RTX2080\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\Rtmp2LOQEk\\file361c69ed481d.df/4.fst"
#> [5] "C:\\Users\\RTX2080\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\Rtmp2LOQEk\\file361c69ed481d.df/5.fst"
#> [6] "C:\\Users\\RTX2080\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\Rtmp2LOQEk\\file361c69ed481d.df/6.fst"

# return the file name chunk IDs with file extension
get_chunk_ids(cars.df, strip_extension = FALSE)
#>   1.fst   2.fst   3.fst   4.fst   5.fst   6.fst 
#> "1.fst" "2.fst" "3.fst" "4.fst" "5.fst" "6.fst" 

# clean up cars.df
delete(cars.df)
